quote: Captain's log, Stardate 43489.2.   We have arrived at Angosia, a   planet that is eager for   membership in the Federation.
I'm greatly impressed with what   I've seen so far, Prime Minister.
Then I hope it will reflect   favorably in your report, Captain.
It's a tribute to your people to   have recovered so rapidly from   the Tarsian War.
It is indeed.       We are not warriors. We believe   reason can settle disputes. But   not every culture agrees with our   position.
An unfortunate reality.
The development of the mind, the   cultivation of the intellect --   these are the pursuits to which   the Angosians have dedicated   themselves for centuries.
I'm sorry to interrupt, Prime   Minister. There's a problem.   May I see you a moment?
Excuse me, gentlemen.
I think they'll make a fine   addition to the Federation, Number   One...
I'm not sure I'd want to live   here. A little stuffy for my   taste.
A prisoner has escaped from the   penal colony on Lunar Five.       Two guards are dead. The prisoner   has taken a transport vessel.
Do you have means of pursuit?

The tracking station was   sabotaged. The entire base is   in chaos. We have ordered ships   from the surface to follow him,   but to be honest, our civilian   pilots are not trained to handle   this...
With your permission, sir... ?
Mister Data, a stolen transport   vessel has departed from Lunar   Five. Have you picked it up on   sensors?
Yes, Commander.
Good. Detain the vessel and   quarantine the pilot.       Is he armed?
Yes. And he's very dangerous,   Captain. Lunar Five is our   maximum security facility.
Did you hear that, Data?
Yes, Commander, we will use   extreme caution.
Keep us informed. Riker out.
On screen, sir...
Specifications on the vessel,   Mister Worf.
No warp drive. Minimal weaponry.
Heading, Ensign Crusher.
Three-one-nine mark   two-five-zero.
Vessel's speed increasing to   point-two impulse. He's seen us,   Data.
The ship's drive section...
What happened to the rest of his   ship?
Scan the drive section for life   form readings.
None.
Mister Crusher, bring us around   to the back side of the asteroid.
Sensors indicate wreckage on the   asteroid's surface.
No life signs.
Apparently, he did not survive.
Data, the drive section...   where'd it go?
There's no sign of it on its   previous heading. Someone must   be at the helm.
Status report, Mister Data?
I am afraid the prisoner has eluded   us, sir.
We followed procedures precisely.   Scanners indicated no life forms   present in the drive section.   I cannot explain how he escaped.
Incoming message from the Angosian   prime minister.
(settling into the     Command Chair)   On screen.
We've identified the prisoner,   Captain. His name is Roga Danar.   His criminal record is too long   to go into. But you must be aware   that he is given to bouts of   uncontrollable violence.
We appreciate the warning, Prime   Minister. We will keep you posted   on our progress.
Mister La Forge, how far and how   fast can that transport ship   travel?
Without warp drive, there's no   way it could be outside our range   by now.
We've been sweeping the area   constantly, Commander. There's   nothing within sensor range.
A cloaking device?
The Angosians have no cloaking   technology...
Unless he's borrowing one...       If he's hanging over the planet's   pole, its magnetic field could   confuse the sensors.
I believe I can recalibrate our   sensors to read through the   electromagnetic interference over   the poles, Commander.
Realign for polar orbit.
Aye, sir.
There he is, Commander. You were   correct.
The fellow knows all the tricks,   doesn't he...
There are still no life form   readings coming from the vessel.
It could be the magnetic   interference, Data.
I have compensated. There are no   readings.
We'll have our answer shortly.   Lock on tractor beam, Mister La   Forge.
Tractor beam locking on.
Sir, the vessel is coming about.
(looking over his     shoulder)   Is he out of his mind?
Sensors detect a massive power   build up in his aft thrusters.
On Main Viewer, Mister Worf.
He's making a suicide run.
Shields have been automatically   activated. Tractor beam   disengaged.
He's bounced off our shields.
That's one trick I didn't even   know about...
Ensign Crusher, fix coordinates   of that vessel. We'll transport   the whole thing to a shuttlebay   if we have to.
I do not think that will be   necessary, Captain. He is no   longer in the drive section.
I anticipated this diversionary   tactic based on his pattern to   date. We are picking up a   cylindrical object approximately   seven meters in length and three   meters in diameter.
On screen, Captain.
An escape pod.
This guy is incredible.
Yet there are still no life form   readings.
Transporter Room Four, prepare   to beam aboard anything that's   large enough to be a humanoid   adult from inside that pod.
Security to Transporter Room Four.
We are holding the contents in   stasis pending arrival of   security. An illicit weapon has   been detected in the transport   beam, sir. It's been rendered   inoperable.
Let's greet our guest.
Just stay where you are.
What the hell...
Take him to the detention cell.   Set phasers on kill.
We need a few hours to get the   containment field on Lunar Five   operational before we pick him   up. The damage he caused during   his escape was considerable.
We will await your signal.
I appreciate your patience. Our   prison psychologist has   recommended you keep Danar fully   sedated until he's ready for   transport.
He's in our highest security   detention area... there shouldn't   be any more problems...

Do not relax your security for   one moment, Captain. He is   extremely violent and cunning,   as you already know, Commander   Riker. I'm so pleased to learn   your injuries are not serious.   My most sincere apologies...
None required, Prime Minister.
I will send a transport vessel   to retrieve him as soon as   possible. Nayrok out.
Have you run a diagnostic on the   sensors, Data?
Yes, Commander. There is nothing   wrong with the ship's sensors.   The reason that we did not sense   any life signs aboard the escape   vessel is because the prisoner   has no life signs.
Computer, identify the occupant   in the detention cell.
The detention cell is vacant at   this time.
Can he be some sort of android?
Our sensors can identify   artificial lifeforms, Captain.   Apparently, he is capable of   deceiving the sensors.
Are you all right?
What is this ship?
You are on board the USS   Enterprise.
A war vessel?
A Federation starship.
Federation...
We were orbiting Angosia when you   escaped from Lunar Five.
It seems I am a victim of my own   bad timing.       And you are the keeper of this   jail?
I am Deanna Troi. Ship's   counselor.
"Counselor". Too bad. I'd rather   you were a jailer to keep me   company during my return trip.
I assume that we are returning   to Lunar Five...
That terrifies you, doesn't it?
I have just killed two men to get   out of there, Counselor.       I am fully capable of killing you   too. A terrifying thought, isn't   it? Even to me.
Do they mistreat you there?
Not at all. I am comfortable,   well fed and housed.       The Angosians take good care of   their... prisoners. I am simply   not allowed to ever leave.

Do you visit all the prisoners,   Counselor? Are you a specialist   in criminal behavior? Or am I   just an interesting specimen that   landed on your ship like an insect   to be studied under your   microscope...
Why do you have such anger toward   me?
A girl with long dark hair broke   my heart long ago... out of   bitterness and rejection, I   turned to crime...
How about this one -- my mother   abandoned me when I was born and   I never had the guidance a wild   young man needs...
Why are you doing this?
Playing games? Isn't that what   you do, Counselor? Isn't that   what all of you mind control   experts do?
I am not a mind control expert.   I came because I sensed you were   in pain.
And now, what do you sense?
The pain is gone.
Interesting, isn't it?
There is a duality in the man...   hard to describe... he is aware   of his crimes... in fact, they   deeply trouble him...
Counselor...

He is intelligent... a thoughtful   man. Typically Angosian. I know   what he's done, but when I am   with him, I cannot believe he is   randomly and deliberately   violent... in fact, inherantly,   he has a non-violent   personality...
Counselor, it took five men to   restrain him... and he took apart   half of the Transporter Room in   the process.
I am not opening the door for him,   Captain.
I can only tell you I sense   something very unusual about this   man. Something that is not   inherent to a criminal   personality...
Your dedication to helping others   in pain is admirable, Counselor.   But in a few hours, I will turn   him over to the Angosians... and   be glad to do so.
I understand.
Data, do we have a link up to the   Angosian central computer?
Yes, Counselor... we are copying   records for Federation inspection   pursuant to their application for   admittance.
Can I see a police record on Roga   Danar?
There is no police record,   Counselor.
But that's impossible. He's been   in prison.
Lunar Five is a military prison   facility...
Military... he's a soldier... ?
That may provide an explanation   for the tactics he was able to   use against us when we tried to   capture him...
(looking over his     shoulder)   It doesn't say what he was   arrested for. Call up his   military record.
He served in many campaigns during   the Tarsian War, received two   promotions, to the rank of   Subhadar... a very honorable tour   of duty...
What was this man's crime?
I've learned you are a soldier.
I was a soldier.
Why were you put in prison?
Obviously, because I am a threat   to society.
There is no police record. What   did you do?
Everything they asked me to do.   That's why I became such a   threat.
I don't understand.
Why are you bothering to try,   Counselor?
I want to help if I can.
(if you really want     to help)   Unlock the door.
Why does a non-violent man commit   acts of excessive violence?
You can learn to do it if you have   to.
Did you have to?
It was war.
This started in the war...
It started the day I volunteered,   Counselor... the day training   began... the day I met my first   instructor. He called himself   a "counselor" too.

Roga Danar was an idealistic young   man who answered his people's call   to service. He joined the   military to fight for the Angosian   way of life. He didn't realize   that by doing so... he would   forever have to give up that way   of life. He's not the same man   who left home to go to war. He's   been through intense psychological   manipulation as well as   biochemical modifications.

At Troi's request I examined   him... his cellular structure   has been been significantly   altered... They used a   combination of cryptobiolin,   triclenidil, macrospentol... and   a few things I don't even   recognize.
Was he a prisoner of war? Who   did this to him?
His own government.

He has been programmed to be the   perfect soldier. He can be   absolutely normal, but whenever   a danger is perceived, the   programming clicks in and takes   over. Intelligence, memory,   strength, reflexes -- all become   enhanced. He is conditioned to   survive at any cost.
One of the new substances in his   cellular structure even shields   electrical impulses.
That would explain why our sensors   did not detect him.
Why was this man assigned to the   Lunar Five facility?

He committed no crime. He says   he was ordered there... with   others like him. The first   soldiers who had returned to   Angosia had trouble. The rules   changed too quickly. A lost   temper could result in murder.
Counselor, did no one try to   adjust their progam?
They were simply exiled to Lunar   Five.
What do you want...
Am I disturbing you?
Yes.
Then I will leave.
Wait. I'd rather talk to someone.   I'm sorry.
Why do you have yellow eyes?
Simply a lack of pigmentation.   I am an android. You and I have   something in common.
We do?
Yes. We have both been   programmed.
Ah, you have been talking with   Counselor Troi.       It is not at all the same,   android.
I do not mean to belittle your   condition. I understand your   dilemma. But I am curious. My   program can be altered and   changed. Yours cannot?
The man I once was is still inside   me... but this conditioning has   been imposed... woven together   with my thoughts and feelings and   responses. How do you separate   the program from the man?
Without further analysis of your   condition by Counselor Troi or   Doctor Crusher, I cannot say.   But it would seem possible.
Doctors. Angosian doctors did   this to me. If it could be   undone, wouldn't they undo it?
I cannot answer that.
Nor can I... and I ask the   question every moment of every   day.
Captain, what he is telling you   is full of half-truths... he is   a prisoner, what do you expect   him to say about us?
Then, perhaps you'd clarify it   for me...
These soldiers were resettled on   Lunar Five... it was to be their   colony...
Their Gulag...
I beg your pardon?
Was it a forced "resettlement"?
It was for their own protection   as well as that of others. Most   of them are quite happy there...
we have gone to great lengths to   give them a fine quality of   life...
Even the most comfortable prison   is a prison, Prime Minister.
A few agitators like Danar forced   us to add security...
Prime Minister, my medical team   has suggested there may be   treatment alternatives...
Captain, I assure you all   alternatives have been explored.   And this discussion is now   treading upon matters of Angosian   security. This is not your   concern.
I have dispatched a ship to   rendezvous with you and transport   the prisoner back to Lunar Five.   On behalf of Angosia, I thank the   Federation for its assistance in   retrieving our citizen.
Were you built for combat,   android?
No. But my program does include   military strategy... that is how   I was finally able to anticipate   your last tactic and capture you.
You did that? Perhaps you would   be better at combat than you   think.
I am not programmed to kill.
My improved reflexes have allowed   me to kill eighty-four times.   And my improved memory lets me   remember the face of each of those   eighty-four. Can you understand   how that feels?
I am incapable of any feeling.
Then I envy you.
Roga, this is Captain Picard
Captain...

Mister Danar, I am going to   transfer you back to Angosian   security. They are en route and   will arrive shortly. I came to   tell you that I have no choice.   The prime minister has insisted   and we have no right to refuse.
And you would be foolish if you   even considered it, Captain...   because they are very correct.   I am dangerous. I have no place   in a civilized society.
I do not believe that.
Nor do I.
I respect my officers' judgement,   Danar. I wish I could help   further. If a way appears to me,   I will.
I appreciate your telling me   face-to-face.
I felt you deserved that much.
You deserve to know that I must   use whatever means I can to   escape.
Captain, the Angosian transport   vessel has arrived.
Inform them the transfer will take   place shortly. Picard out.   Mister Data, to the bridge   please...
Take care of yourself, android.   I enjoyed our talk.
Good-bye, Roga.
Perhaps when this planet becomes   a member of the Federation, we   will be able...
I will not be here to see it,   Counselor. Because even with this   overwhelming demand to survive   that they've built into my soul...   I would rather die than return   to Lunar Five.
Captain Picard, we're ready to   receive the prisoner. Now   transmitting the coordinates of   our holding cell.
Coordinates received, sir.
Stand by for transport. Picard   out.
Mister Worf, have all security   precautions been taken?
Release of the force field and   activation of the transporter   will be virtually simultaneous,   Captain... There will only be   a point-one second interval   between them.
Even Danar can't move that fast.
There will be a full security   contingent present. Phasers will   be set on kill.
Proceed.
Transporter Room One to Lieutenant   Worf. We're ready.
Proceed.
Energizing...
Roga, don't, you'll be killed...
I'm losing him... what the   hell... ?
Security personnel, full alert.   Shut down all shuttlebays,   transporters, and turbolifts.
Captain, a phaser is missing.   We must assume that he's armed.
Sound general quarters. Clear   corridors of all non-essential   personnel. I don't want him   taking any hostages.
General quarters sounded, sir.
Raise security containment fields   immediately on decks thirty-four,   thirty-five, and thirty-six.
Data... put the turbolifts back   on line. If Danar sees they're   operating, he may try to use one.
Soon as he does, we have him.
Sir, unauthorized access of   turbolift dive on deck thirty-four.
He took the bait.
Data -- override its destination   and divert that turbolift to a   position near Lieutenant Worf's   current location.
We're in position.
Four seconds to arrival.
Phaser on overload! Seal this   deck --
Captain, the overload's been   averted.
Ingenious.
Drop force field on deck   thirty-six.
Sir, containment field down on   deck thirty-six.
How the hell did he manage that?
He's headed for Engineering.
Riker to La Forge.
Engineering -- respond.
Sir -- someone in Engineering is   attempting to override the   security system lockout.
Riker to Worf. He's in   Engineering...
Acknowledged, Commander.
Data -- I want you to stall   Danar. Allow him to think he's   succeeding.
As he bypasses each subsystem,   I can reroute it without his   knowledge.
Make it so.
Danar is extremely adept, sir.   I am not certain which security   measure he is attempting to   circumvent.       Sir, Danar has succeeded in   restoring power to Shuttlebay Two.
I have overridden Danar's bypass;   Shuttlebay Two is once again   inactive.
Very good, Mister Data. And now   we know where he's headed.
He surprised us... came out of   nowhere. I didn't know anyone   could move that fast...
Lieutenant, I am reading an open   access panel... K-twelve, deck   thirty.
Acknowledged.
Danar must have climbed the   reactor core and gotten into a   Jefferies tube. He could be   anywhere.
We believe he is attempting to   reach Shuttlebay Two.
That's twenty-five decks up from   here... quite a climb... but I   wouldn't put it past him...
There is a full contingent of   security waiting at all   shuttlebays.
You want my advice... double it.
Reading another open access   panel...
Security team to Jefferies tube   J-four, deck fifteen.
Security acknowledges. On our   way.
Deck fifteen. Only a few decks   below the shuttlebay.
Captain, I find it highly unlikely   that Danar is attempting to reach   Shuttlebay Two.
Explain.
In our previous encounter, Danar   employed a strategy of   misdirection in an attempt to gain   his objective.
And you believe he's using the   same tactic now.
He is aware that our sensors are   unable to track him. Yet he seems   to be purposely leaving a trail   for us to follow.
And where do you think he's   headed.
I am afraid his true destination   remains a mystery.
Captain, readings now indicate   an open access panel... Jeffries   tube N-eleven, deck thirty-eight.
He doubled back on us.
The cargo bays?
Advise personnel on deck   thirty-eight to stay out of all   Cargo Bays.
They would appear to be empty,   sir.
Good. I want you to flood them   with Anastazine.
Sensors show Anestazine   concentration of seventy parts   per million within the cargo   bays.
That should have put our boy to   sleep.
Restore normal environmental   conditions, Mister Data.
Move in security teams, Mister   Worf.
Acknowledged.
Worf to bridge. We have found no   sign of the intruder. But there is   a pressure suit missing from Cargo   Bay Three.
A pressure suit...
Could be he's planning to enter   Shuttlebay Two from outside the   Enterprise... bypassing the   security guards.
Mister Worf --
Post security guards at all   emergency airlocks on decks   thirty-seven through thirty-nine...
Aye, sir. I'll also cover the   photon torpedo launchers... Danar   may attempt to leave the ship that   way. Worf out.
You are cunning, Danar... you must   have Klingon blood. But the   battle is over.
My battle is never over.
Worf to bridge. I have Danar...
Explosion in Jefferies Tube   section T-nine-five. All external   sensors are inoperative.
Go to backup systems.
Unable to transfer control...
Worf to bridge. Danar has   escaped. He used a phaser to   power the cargo transporter.       Coordinates indicate he beamed   aboard the Angosian transport   ship.
Data, can you verify that?
Negative. External sensors are   still nonfunctioning.
Then we have no way to track him.
That was his plan all along.
First officer's log, supplemental.   We are continuing to repair damage   to the ship's sensors following   the escape of the Angosian   prisoner Danar. He is still at   large.
Engineering, I'm getting readings   at Tactical, are we back up...
That's affirmative, Commander.
Sweep the area, Mister Worf...
Captain, the prime minister is   hailing us, priority one...
On screen.
Yes, Prime Minister.
Captain, I've just been informed   that Roga Danar has attacked the   penal colony on Lunar Five...
Attacked it... ?

In our own police shuttle.   Several of my people are wounded.   Hundreds of prisoners are rioting.   Some of them have escaped with   Danar. We have reports they are   headed for the capitol city...       Captain, we are not suited to   handle situations like this...   that's why we created them...
We'll send an away team, Prime   Minister... Picard out.
Counselor Troi, Mister Data,   Lieutenant Worf... you will   accompany me to the planet...
My understanding is that these   men were programmed to survive,   is that correct?
Yes, Captain.
And they will not kill unless   their survival is at stake?
It is against their nature to do   so, Captain.
Then let us hope they do not   believe their survival is at   stake.
Mister Worf, you are personally   responsible for the captain's   safety.
I understand, Commander.
(addressing the     senators)   I do not expect them to listen   to reason... I loathe the idea   of a violent confrontation, but   we must be prepared...
This is all you've brought... ?   Where are your security men... ?
We're not here to fight your wars,   Prime Minister...
They've been seen moving toward   the center of the city... people   are scared, Captain... don't you   understand... ? They're dangerous.
You are dangerous. They are only   victims.       You made them what they are. You   asked them to defend your way of   life... then you discarded them.
They were not happy here...
They were not welcome here.
It was the will of the people to   resettle them...
Nobody was pleased with the   solution, Captain... but we had   to act for the greater good...
Prime Minister, if you have the   skills to create a master   soldier, can you not contradict   the effect... ?
The chemicals can be removed from   their systems. But we're not   convinced the psychological   conditioning can be entirely   reversed.
Have you tried?
We've studied it thoroughly...   even before the training began,   we knew there would be problems   reversing it. It was a risk we   had to take.
Did you reveal that "risk" to the   men who volunteered for service?
We were helping them to survive the,   war, don't you understand? They   needed these skills...
They are your sons, your brothers.   And you have turned your backs on   them.
There are methods of treatment...   until you try them, you can't know   if they will work. Even a partial   recovery would give them some   peace...
It was the will of the people...
(losing patience with     this guy)   To allow them to suffer?
There was a referendum. The   people weighed the costs involved.   They chose the resettlement   solution.
Besides, we may need to use them   again some day.
Unless you are prepared to die,   I'd suggest you put that down.
Do as he says.
Shoot us. Destroy us. Do what   you have to do. But, by God, you   will no longer ignore us.
Danar, it appears to me that you   are deliberately attempting to   provoke a response... so you may   justify your own attack on men   who do not wish to fight...
Cowards...
Yes...       But you are not programmed to   murder cowards... and if they will   not fight back, what will you   do?
We will not go back...
You are programmed to survive...   you can survive at the Lunar Five   settlement...
Survival is not enough... to exist   is not enough...
Roga, tell them what you want.
We want our lives back. We want   to come home.
I'm not prepared to negotiate   under a threat, Danar... but if   you will put down your arms and   return peacefully to Lunar Five...   I would be willing...
Mister Prime Minister. Our   respects, sir. But you'll have   to force us... or try to.
Captain, you must do something,   call your ship...
You're quite right, Prime   Minister.       Enterprise, prepare to beam the   away team back.
At your command, Captain.
You can't leave us like this,   Picard.

We have everything we need for   our report. Your prisoner has   been returned to you. You have   a decision to make... either try   to force them back or welcome them   home. In your own words, this   is not our affair. We cannot   interfere with the natural course   of your society's development and   I'd say it's likely to develop   significantly during the next   several minutes.       It's been an interesting stay.   When you are ready for membership   in the Federation, we will be   pleased to reconsider your   application.
Four to beam up, Mister Riker.
Success, Captain?
Number One, note in your report   that if the government of Angosia   survives the night, we will offer   Federation assistance in the   efforts to reprogram their   veterans.
And if the government doesn't   survive?
I have a feeling they will choose   to.
Mister Crusher, set coordinates   for the starbase at Lya Three.
Coordinates set, Captain.
Engage.
